title: 'South' Logotype: amateurish finger-sans caps
content:
I'm redesigning a logo and they want an option using their existing type. Not sure if its a font or drawn.  
Any help would be HUGELY appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202105758im_/http:/typophile.com/files/south_4435.jpg)
author: WChaplin

comments.content:
I reckon it's a squashed Arial Black italic with some corners rounded off...

Peter
Actually, not even italic. Probably just skewed.
Could also have been drawn from scratch. Frankly I don't see a too-striking resemblance with Arial (check the curve/spine of the "S").

Why don't you ask 'them' what it is? BTW, what's going on with that kerning?

Nick Cooke

<cite>what’s going on with that kerning?</cite>

That's would be better as "what’s kerning?"  
;-)

Thanks for the feedback. I suspected it was hand-drawn but thought it might be an obscure font someone knew.

@ Nick & riccard0 - in the actual logo the characters are all overlapping! I just grabbed the first five and put some space between them to submit to identifont.

'They' don't know - these are 2 good old 'blokes' who build stuff.

Thanks again.
